title: Retail worker’s attempt to resign turns into a game of cat and mouse as her boss ignores and keeps calling her in for shifts she’s already quit: ‘I make it clear I’m resigning, not taking leave, she tells me to “let her know when I'm ready to come back”’
description: Some retail jobs are so desperate to keep warm bodies behind the register that quitting feels more like trying to escape a cult than leaving a minimum-wage gig. The young employee at the center of this unfortunate place of work spent nearly a year juggling arbitrary schedule changes, illegal timecard shenanigans, and a general manager whose favorite hobby is boundary erosion. The highlights include being scolded for not showing up to work while literally standing at the register, getting docked for fifteen minutes of labor because it was "too late" to fix, and being told to "be mindful" of a terminal illness, because apparently, passing is only acceptable if it doesn't interfere with store coverage.
author: Etai Eshet
